news_items.headline: BRIEF-Facebook Says Coronavirus Will Impact Oculus Headset Production - Bloomberg
news_items.lede: * FACEBOOK SAYS CORONAVIRUS WILL IMPACT OCULUS HEADSET PRODUCTION - BLOOMBERG Source text - https://bloom.bg/39lLlY9 Further company coverage:

news_items.headline: Canadian agency asks federal court to declare Facebook contravened privacy law
news_items.lede: Canada's privacy commissioner asked a federal court to declare that Facebook had broken federal privacy law for the private sector, according to a notice of application filed on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An attendee takes a photograph of a sign during Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam -/File Photo

news_items.headline: Canadian agency asks federal court to declare Facebook contravened privacy law
news_items.lede: Canada's privacy commissioner asked a federal court to declare that Facebook had broken federal privacy law for the private sector, according to a notice of application filed on Thursday.

news_items.headline: Snap misses quarterly revenue estimates, shares sink
news_items.lede: Snap Inc <SNAP.N> missed Wall Street estimates for fourth quarter revenue on Tuesday as it faced tough competition from digital advertising giants Google and Facebook, sending its shares down 10%.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A woman stands in front of the logo of Snap Inc. on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) while waiting for Snap Inc. to post their IPO, in New York City, New York, U.S. on March 2, 2017. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook increases parental control features in Messenger Kids app
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it plans to add new tools and features for parental control in its messaging app for users under the age of 13, months after questions rose about application's privacy protection for children.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Small toy figures are seen in front of Facebook logo in this illustration picture, April 8, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook's Sheryl Sandberg gets engaged
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg on Monday announced her engagement to the head of a consulting firm.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO - Sheryl Sandberg, COO of Facebook and current chair of the Global Internet Forum to Counter Terrorism (GIFCT), gives a news conference on the sidelines during the 2019 United Nations Climate Action Summit at U.N. headquarters in New York City, New York, U.S., September 23, 2019. REUTERS/Yana Paskova

news_items.headline: Facebook to remove coronavirus misinformation after WHO declares global emergency
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it will take down misinformation about China's fast-spreading coronavirus in a rare departure from its approach to health content, after the World Health Organization declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Small toy figures are seen in front of Facebook logo in this illustration picture, April 8, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Zuckerberg pledges Facebook users privacy upgrades after $550 million facial recognition settlement
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc has reached a $550 million settlement of claims it collected and stored millions of users' biometric data without their consent, as Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg pledged better protections for users to address privacy concerns that have dogged the social media...
news_items.img_cap: The logo of Facebook is seen in Davos, Switzerland Januar 20, 2020. Picture taken January 20, 2020. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann

news_items.headline: UPDATE 1-Zuckerberg pledges Facebook users privacy upgrades after $550 million facial recognition settlement
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc has reached a $550 million settlement of claims it collected and stored millions of users' biometric data without their consent, as Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg pledged better protections for users to address privacy concerns that have dogged the social media...

news_items.headline: Facebook shares hit by slowest growth in years, higher expenses
news_items.lede: Shares of Facebook Inc <FB.O> fell 7% on Thursday after the social media giant posted its slowest quarterly growth since its market debut as expenses mount and warned of continued stagnant growth.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Facebook is seen in Davos, Switzerland Januar 20, 2020. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann

news_items.headline: Facebook warns revenue growth slowing, costs remain high
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc <FB.O> said on Wednesday that growth would continue to slow as its business matured and it reported a surge in quarterly expenses, disappointing Wall Street expectations that the costs of improving privacy would level off.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A woman looks at the Facebook logo on a screen, June 3, 2018. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Breakingviews - Facebook’s user black box is cause for concern
news_items.lede: Facebook shareholders risk focusing on the wrong problem. They punished Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg’s $636 billion company in after-hours trading on Wednesday, sending the stock down as much as 7% on the back of fourth-quarter earnings that showed rising costs and slowing...
news_items.img_cap: A 3D-printed Facebook logo are seen in front of displayed binary digits in this illustration taken, March 18, 2018. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Facebook taps top privacy lawyer from First Republic
news_items.lede: The top privacy lawyer at First Republic Bank said she is leaving for a similar spot at Facebook Inc, as the social media company grapples with recent government fines and criticism over its handling of consumer data.

news_items.headline: News Corp. launches news aggregation site Knewz to counter Facebook, Google
news_items.lede: News Corp <NWSA.O> on Wednesday launched a free news aggregation service, Knewz, to address its long-held criticism of how Google and Facebook <FB.O> treat publishers and journalists.

news_items.headline: REFILE-Facebook just beats estimates for daily active users, costs rise
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc just beat analysts' estimates for daily active users on Wednesday, as the world's largest social network faced fierce competition for users' screen time from a slew of entertainment apps like TikTok and Netflix.

news_items.headline: How Facebook thinks its independent oversight board should work
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc recommended rules on Tuesday for how its independent oversight board will work and said a former human rights group director will lead the board's administrative staff.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A man poses with a magnifier in front of a Facebook logo on display in this illustration taken in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, December 16, 2015. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook VP of engineering Jay Parikh says leaving company
news_items.lede: Facebook's vice president of engineering, Jay Parikh, said in a post on the social network on Tuesday that he was planning to leave the company, marking the exit of another key executive following a string of high-profile departures last year.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Facebook application is seen on a phone screen August 3, 2017.   REUTERS/Thomas White/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook, others restrict business travel to China as warnings grow
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc and other global companies including LG Electronics Inc and Standard Chartered Plc are restricting travel to China, as the death toll from a flu-like virus rose above 100 on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Facebook asks employees to put off non-essential travel to China
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc <FB.O> has asked employees to suspend non-essential travel to mainland China to prevent the spread of the coronavirus, a spokesman said on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook signs are seen during the China International Import Expo (CIIE), at the National Exhibition and Convention Center in Shanghai, China November 5, 2018. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: Italy watchdog threatens Facebook with another fine over improper use of data
news_items.lede: Italy's competition watchdog said on Friday it has launched proceedings against Facebook for non-compliance with a request to correct improper commercial practices in the group's treatment of user data.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Facebook is seen in Davos, Switzerland Januar 20, 2020.  REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann

news_items.headline: Italy watchdog launches non-compliance proceedings against Facebook
news_items.lede: Italy's competition watchdog has launched proceedings against Facebook for non-compliance with a previous request it had made regarding improper commercial practices in the group's treatment of user data, the agency said on Friday.

news_items.headline: Facebook spurred central banks to study digital currencies: former Japan central banker
news_items.lede: The challenge posed by Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency likely prodded major central banks to set up a new group to study the potential for issuing their own digital currencies, a former Bank of Japan executive said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Representations of virtual currency are displayed in front of the Libra logo in this illustration picture, June 21, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic

news_items.headline: Facebook tweaks ad policy but still allows political lies in U.S. campaign 2020
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc <FB.O> announced limited changes on Thursday to its approach to political ads, including allowing users to turn off certain ad-targeting tools, but defied critics' demands that it bar politicians from using its ads system to spread lies.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Stickers bearing the Facebook logo are pictured at Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam

news_items.headline: Vodafone Group exits Facebook-led Libra currency group
news_items.lede: Britain's Vodafone Group PLC <VOD.L> has left the entity that manages the Facebook Inc <FB.O> led effort to launch Libra, a global digital currency, Libra Association said on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: A man checks his mobile phone next to a Vodafone logo at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain, February 28, 2018. REUTERS/Sergio Perez

news_items.headline: Vodafone Group exits Facebook-led Libra currency group
news_items.lede: Britain's Vodafone Group PLC has left the entity that manages the Facebook Inc led effort to launch Libra, a global digital currency, Libra Association said on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Facebook targets UK growth with 1,000 hires this year
news_items.lede: Facebook will hire 1,000 people in London this year in roles such as product development and safety as it continues to grow its biggest engineering center outside the United States after Britain leaves the European Union.
news_items.img_cap: Nicola Mendelsohn, Facebook's Vice-President for Europe, the Middle East and Africa sits for a portrait following a Reuters interview in London, Britain January 20, 2020. REUTERS/Toby Melville

news_items.headline: Facebook sued in U.S. federal court for alleged anticompetitive conduct
news_items.lede: Four companies sued Facebook Inc <FB.O> in U.S. federal court on Thursday for alleged anticompetitive conduct, saying the social network inappropriately revoked developer access to its platform in order to harm prospective competitors.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a mobile phone in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron/Illustration

news_items.headline: Lessons to be learned from Facebook's WhatsApp deal, French watchdog says
news_items.lede: Facebook's $22 billion buyout of WhatsApp six years ago should have been blocked, the boss of France's antitrust watchdog, which is set to help review EU rules, has told Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Head of France's competition authority, Isabelle de Silva, speaks during an interview with Reuters in Paris, France, January 16, 2020. REUTERS/Charles Platiau

news_items.headline: Facebook sued in U.S. federal court for alleged anticompetitive conduct
news_items.lede: Four companies sued Facebook in U.S. federal court on Thursday for alleged anticompetitive conduct, saying the social network inappropriately revoked developer access to its platform in order to harm prospective competitors.

news_items.headline: Facebook's stock hits record high, signaling recovery after extended historic slump
news_items.lede: Shares of Facebook <FB.O>, which have been doggedly crawling their way back from a historic slump after lapses in users' privacy sparked fears of lower profits, on Friday struck an intra-day record high for the first time in over a year.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Facebook logo is seen on a screen in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron

news_items.headline: Facebook's Zuckerberg drops annual challenges to focus on longer-term goals
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday he was dropping his annual challenges this year to take a longer-term focus on the decade ahead.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook Chairman and CEO Mark Zuckerberg testifies at a House Financial Services Committee hearing on Capitol Hill in Washington, U.S., October 23, 2019. REUTERS/Erin Scott

news_items.headline: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg drops annual challenges to focus on longer-term goals
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday he was dropping his annual challenges this year to take a longer term focus on the decade ahead.

news_items.headline: Facebook and eBay pledge to better tackle fake reviews
news_items.lede: Facebook and eBay have promised to better identify, probe and respond to fake and misleading reviews, Britain's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said on Wednesday after pressing the online platforms to tackle the issue.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Facebook logo is seen on a screen in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron/Illustration

news_items.headline: Ireland adds more multinational jobs, sees risks ahead
news_items.lede: Job announcements from Facebook <FB.O> and Salesforce <CRM.N> pushed employment among multinationals in Ireland 6% higher last year but the state agency competing to win foreign business said it saw significant risks to future growth.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A general view of Facebook's elections operation centre in Dublin, Ireland May 2, 2019. Picture taken May 2, 2019. REUTERS/Lorraine O'Sullivan

news_items.headline: Pelosi spokesman dismisses Facebook decision to remove some manipulated videos
news_items.lede: A spokesman for the U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi dismissed Facebook's <FB.O> announcement that it would remove deepfakes and some other manipulated videos from its platform as inadequate on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, joined by fellow Democrats, speaks during a news conference about legislation the House has passed at the Capitol in Washington, U.S., December 19, 2019. REUTERS/Erin Scott

news_items.headline: Facebook to remove deepfake videos in run-up to 2020 U.S. election
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc said it will remove deepfakes and other manipulated videos from its platform if they have been edited, but not content that is parody or satire, in a move aimed at curbing misinformation ahead of the U.S. presidential election.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Stickers bearing the Facebook logo are pictured at Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam

news_items.headline: Pelosi spokesman dismisses Facebook decision to remove some manipulated videos
news_items.lede: A spokesman for the U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi dismissed Facebook's announcement that it would remove deepfakes and some other manipulated videos from its platform as inadequate on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Facebook defies China headwinds with new ad sales push
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc <FB.O> is setting up a new engineering team in Singapore to focus on its lucrative China advertising business, according to three people familiar with the effort, even as chief executive Mark Zuckerberg ramps up criticism of a country that blocks the social...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group Jack Ma laugh as they meet at the China Development Forum in Beijing, China, March 19, 2016. REUTERS/Shu Zhang/File Photo

news_items.headline: Brazil fines Facebook $1.6 million for improper sharing of user data
news_items.lede: Brazil's Ministry of Justice said on Monday it fined U.S. tech giant Facebook Inc 6.6 million reais ($1.6 million) for improperly sharing user data.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouettes of laptop users are seen next to a screen projection of a Facebook logo, March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic

news_items.headline: Facebook removes misleading HIV drug ads after outcry
news_items.lede: Facebook said on Monday it had removed some ads that contained misleading information about HIV prevention drugs following an outcry from activists, health experts and U.S. lawmakers.

news_items.headline: Introducing the Reuters guide to Manipulated media, in association with the Facebook Journalism Project
news_items.lede: For almost every globally significant news event of 2019 – and of these there were many - it is possible to identify misleading video and pictures that were shared on social media in the aftermath.
news_items.img_cap: Reuters-Facebook Journalism Project course on Identifying and Tackling Manipulated Media

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-Brazil fines Facebook $1.6 mln for improper sharing of user data
news_items.lede: Brazil's Ministry of Justice said on Monday it has fined U.S. tech giant Facebook Inc 6.6 million reais ($1.64 million) for improperly sharing user data.

news_items.headline: Facebook's Libra has failed in current form: Swiss president
news_items.lede: Facebook's <FB.O> Libra project has failed in its current form and needs reworking to be approved, said the president of Switzerland where the cryptocurrency is seeking regulatory consent.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A small toy figure is seen on representations of the virtual currency on a displayed European Union flag and the Facebook Libra logo in this illustration picture, October 20, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Fed Circuit won't rehear fight on Facebook 'prevailing party' status
news_items.lede: A federal appeals court on Thursday said it would not revisit a recent ruling in favor of Facebook Inc that clarified what constitutes a "prevailing party" in a patent case.

news_items.headline: Facebook EU user data transfer contracts are legal, but risks ahead: EU court adviser
news_items.lede: Agreements that let Facebook and other firms send European citizens' data to the United States and other countries are valid, a key EU court adviser said on Thursday, although he left room for such transfers to be blocked if European data protection standards are not met...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a screen in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook separates security tool from friend suggestions, citing privacy overhaul
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc will no longer feed user phone numbers provided to it for two-factor authentication into its "people you may know" feature, as part of a wide-ranging overhaul of its privacy practices, the company told Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A woman looks at the Facebook logo on an iPad in this photo illustration taken June 3, 2018. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau/Illustration

news_items.headline: Instagram bans influencers from promoting vaping products
news_items.lede: Social media influencers will no longer be allowed to promote vaping, tobacco products and weapons on Instagram as the Facebook-owned platform doubles down on its existing ad policies banning the advertisements of such products.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouettes of mobile users are seen next to a screen projection of Instagram logo in this picture illustration taken March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration

news_items.headline: Facebook's Libra lacks solid plan for launch- governing board member
news_items.lede: Facebook's <FB.O> Libra project has no solid plan yet for how or where it will be launched next year, a member of the board that will oversee the cryptocurrency told Reuters on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Representations of virtual currency are displayed in front of the Libra logo in this illustration picture, June 21, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook's Libra 2020 launch plan still unclear - board member
news_items.lede: Facebook's Libra project has no solid strategy yet for how or where it will be introduced next year, a board member of the body overseeing the hotly-anticipated cryptocurrency told Reuters on Thursday.

news_items.headline: Austria's Schrems sees positives in EU Facebook court case
news_items.lede: Austrian privacy advocate Max Schrems said he was "generally happy" with the legal opinion of an adviser to Europe's top court in his long-running dispute with Facebook, saying it followed almost all of his arguments.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Austrian lawyer and privacy activist Max Schrems displays his Facebook account's updated terms page during a Reuters interview in a cafe in Vienna, Austria, May 22, 2018.  REUTERS/Heinz-Peter Bader/File Photo

news_items.headline: Instagram bans influencers from promoting vaping products
news_items.lede: Social media influencers will be banned from promoting vaping, tobacco products and weapons on Instagram as the Facebook-owned platform doubles down on its existing ban on companies advertising these products.

news_items.headline: Crunch moment for Facebook in clash with privacy activist Schrems
news_items.lede: Facebook's clash with Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems reaches a critical point on Thursday when an adviser to Europe's top court will offer his view on whether tools used by companies to transfer data abroad protect European citizens' data.

news_items.headline: Fed's Brainard: Facebook's Libra faces 'core set' of regulatory hurdles
news_items.lede: U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Lael Brainard launched a broadside against Facebook's Libra digital currency project on Wednesday, saying it faces a "core set of legal and regulatory challenges" including clarity about how it would be tied to some basket of underlying assets.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A small toy figure stands on representations of virtual currency in front of the Libra logo in this illustration picture, June 21, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook to pilot new fact-checking program with community reviewers
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it would ask community reviewers to fact check content in a pilot program in the United States, as the social media platform looks to detect misinformation faster.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a screen in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook to pilot new fact-checking program with community reviewers
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it would ask community reviewers to fact check content in a pilot program in the United States, as the social media platform looks to detect misinformation faster.

news_items.headline: Reuters partners with Facebook Journalism Project to help newsrooms around the world spot deepfakes and manipulated media
news_items.lede: Reuters, the world’s largest multimedia news provider, announced today the launch of an e-learning course to help newsrooms around the world spot deepfakes and manipulated media, produced in partnership with the Facebook Journalism Project. ‘Identifying and Tackling Manipulated...
news_items.img_cap: Reuters-Facebook Journalism Project - Identifying and Tackling Manipulated Media Course

news_items.headline: Facebook, privacy activist Schrems battle nears end on Dec. 19
news_items.lede: Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems' seven-year battle against Facebook reaches a crucial point on Dec. 17 when an adviser to Europe's top court will issue his view on whether tools used by companies to transfer data abroad are legal or not.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a screen in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron/Illustration

news_items.headline: U.S. regulator weighs action against Facebook over how its apps interact: report
news_items.lede: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is considering asking a court to stop Facebook Inc from moving ahead with plans to integrate its WhatsApp, Instagram and Messenger subsidiaries, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a mobile phone in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron

news_items.headline: Facebook pledges $130 million to content oversight board, delays naming members
news_items.lede: Facebook said on Thursday it committed an initial $130 million to fund an independent oversight board, but said it would not announce its members this year, as originally expected.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouettes of laptop users are seen next to a screen projection of a Facebook logo, March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/File Photo

news_items.headline: FTC weighs seeking injunction against Facebook over how its apps interact - WSJ
news_items.lede: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is considering seeking a preliminary injunction against Facebook Inc over antitrust concerns related to how its products interact, The Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/ftc-weighs-seeking-injunction-against-facebook-over-how-its-apps-interact...

news_items.headline: REFILE-Facebook delays naming oversight board members until 2020
news_items.lede: Facebook will not announce the first members of its independent oversight board this year as it originally expected, the company said on Thursday.

news_items.headline: Facebook sues ILikeAd, alleges ad fraud
news_items.lede: (This Dec. 5 story corrects first paragraph to clarify alleged timing of malware installation)
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a screen in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron/Illustration

news_items.headline: Facebook no longer among Glassdoor's top 10 workplaces
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc <FB.O> dropped to the 23rd spot in Glassdoor's list of "Best Places to Work" in 2020 from the seventh it secured last year, amid heightened regulatory scrutiny of the world's largest social network.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouettes of laptop users are seen next to a screen projection of Facebook logo in this picture illustration taken March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration

news_items.headline: U.S. senators threaten Facebook, Apple with encryption regulation
news_items.lede: U.S. senators grilled Apple Inc and Facebook Inc executives over their encryption practices on Tuesday and threatened to regulate the technology unless the companies make encrypted user data accessible to law enforcement.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook logos are seen on a mobile phone in this picture illustration taken December 2, 2019. REUTERS/Johanna Geron

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Kansas disciplines court reporter for Facebook posts
news_items.lede: A Kansas judge on Friday ruled that a court reporter who had shared on social media her opinions about a murder trial that she had worked on broke the state's rules on judicial impartiality and should be subject to public discipline.

news_items.headline: Hungary watchdog fines Facebook for misleading users
news_items.lede: Hungary's competition watchdog has fined Facebook 1.2 billion forints ($4 million), its biggest fine to date, for misleading users by claiming its services were free.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Facebook application is seen on a phone screen August 3, 2017.   REUTERS/Thomas White/File Photo

news_items.headline: EU agrees tough line on digital currencies like Facebook's Libra
news_items.lede: Private digital currencies such as Facebook's Libra should not be allowed in the European Union until the risks they could pose are clearly addressed, EU finance ministers agreed on Thursday.

news_items.headline: Facebook warns EU regulators seeking data access about privacy, liability risks
news_items.lede: Facebook warned European Union regulators on Monday against forcing tech giants to open their vast troves of data to rivals, saying such a move would carry privacy and liability risks.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Stickers bearing the Facebook logo are pictured at Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook to allow transfer of photos, videos to Google Photos
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc said on Monday it has introduced an option to transfer photos and videos from the social media network directly to other services, starting with Google Photos.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Facebook application is seen on a phone screen August 3, 2017.   REUTERS/Thomas White/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook issues corrective label on user's post under new Singapore fake news law
news_items.lede: Facebook <FB.O> said on Saturday it had issued a correction notice on a user's post at the request of the Singapore government, but called for a measured approach to the implementation of a new "fake news" law in the city-state.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouettes of laptop users are seen next to a screen projection of Facebook logo in this picture illustration taken March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Singapore tells Facebook to correct user's post in test of 'fake news' laws
news_items.lede: Singapore instructed Facebook <FB.O> on Friday to publish a correction on a user's social media post under a new "fake news" law, raising fresh questions about how the company will adhere to government requests to regulate content.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouettes of laptop users are seen next to a screen projection of Facebook logo in this picture illustration taken March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook must face data breach class action on security, but not damages: judge
news_items.lede: A federal judge said up to 29 million Facebook Inc <FB.O> users whose personal information was stolen in a September 2018 data breach cannot sue as a group for damages, but can seek better security at the social media company after a series of privacy lapses.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook Chairman and CEO Mark Zuckerberg testifies at a House Financial Services Committee hearing in Washington, U.S., October 23, 2019. REUTERS/Erin Scott/File Photo

news_items.headline: Senate Democrats unveil privacy bill with fines for privacy violations
news_items.lede: Democratic senators proposed legislation on Tuesday that would set penalties for online companies like Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc if they mishandle users' personal data.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Children on a school trip pose for a photo in front of the U.S. Capitol building on Capitol Hill in Washington, U.S., November 22, 2019. REUTERS/Loren Elliott

news_items.headline: Senate Democrats introduce privacy bill with fines for privacy violations -Wash Post
news_items.lede: Senator Maria Cantwell, backed by three other Democrats, proposed legislation that would set penalties for digital giants like Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc if they mishandle users' personal data, the Washington Post reported on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Facebook agrees to provide additional documents in California AG data privacy probe
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc has agreed to turn over additional documents after the California state attorney general's office went to court this month to compel the social media firm to comply with requests for information in its privacy investigation.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Stickers bearing the Facebook logo are pictured at Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook signs lease for office space in Hudson Yards
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc signed a lease for over 1.5 million square feet of office space across 30 floors and three buildings in New York City's Hudson Yards, according to a statement by the luxury and commercial real estate development on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An attendee takes a photograph of a sign during Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam/File Photo

news_items.headline: Facebook signs lease for office space in Hudson Yards
news_items.lede: Facebook Inc signed a lease for over 1.5 million square feet of office space across 30 floors and three buildings in New York City's Hudson Yards, according to a statement by the luxury and commercial real estate development on Thursday.
